The Happiness Movement is about discovering your own authentic happiness, and sharing it with family, friends and your community.

The Happiness Movement is about discovering your own authentic happiness, and sharing it with family, friends and your community. Happiness is contagious, and our goal is to create a world with more compassion, less strife and a greater sense of purpose and meaning. You can claim responsibility for your own happiness and become a catalyst of happiness in others lives.

Millions of people have decided not to be sensitive. They have grown thick skins around themselves just to avoid being hurt by anybody. But it is at great cost. Nobody can hurt them, but nobody can make them happy either.

At this very moment, you may be saying to yourself that you have any number of admirable qualities. You are a loyal friend, a caring person, someone who is smart, dependable, fun to be around. Thats wonderful, and Im happy for you, but let me ask you this: are you being any of those things to yourself?

I traveled with family to Jordan and stayed there from February-August. My sister in law was getting married but I was there for so much more. I really wanted my children to meet my husband's side of the family, and hopefully learn some Arabic. My children picked up so much Arabic, but especially my 21 month old! She was 16 months when we arrived, and since 18 months is a huge leap in vocabulary she really learned a lot. Which is great!

Being in Jordan was great- for about 3 weeks. After that it wasn't vacation, it was living there and that wasn't something I had expected. Despite the positives, I was sooo happy to come home. Every little thing I am grateful for. Libraries, insurance, doctors, water fountains, my house and husband (who wasn't able to come but for 11 days).

I have PCOS (polycystic ovarian syndrome). Basically, my body has a hormonal imbalance. My ovary tries to release an egg but it doesn't happen, instead it just turns into a cyst on the ovary. Periods are so random and all over the place because ovulation just doesn't happen that often. After 3 years of  nothing, I GOT MY PERIOD!!!!!!!!!! THIS IS AMAZING!!! Maybe, just maybe, my hormones can calm down and I can actually get pregnant without medical intervention. That would be fantastic!

At the first time, I was afraid that I couldn't communicate with people here because my English was bad. So I decided to learn more about English by taking General English Course at IH London. It was a very good experience because I met new friends there from around the world who had the same objective: IMPROVING our ability in English.

eres an interesting fact about happiness: frequency beats intensity. Whats that mean?Lots of little good things make you happier than a handful of big things.Research shows that going to church and exercising both bring people a disproportionate amount of happiness. Why?They give us frequent, regular boosts.Stanford professor Jennifer Aaker says its really that simple: the things that make you happy, do them more often.

Both actions happened in the past so we use the past simple tense. But look at how we can combine the sentences.    Mary rang Johns doorbell at 8:15 yesterday but John had already left the house.We use the past perfect (had left) because the action happened before another action in the past (Mary rang the doorbell.)Look at some more examples of the past perfect.    When Mrs Brown opened the washing machine she realised she had washed the cat.    I got a letter from Jim last week. Wed been at school together but wed lost touch with each other.The past perfect is used because they were at school before he received the letter. It refers to an earlier past.Look at these 2 sentences.    James had cooked breakfast when we got up.    James cooked breakfast when we got up.

They devote a great amount of time to their family and friends, nurturing and enjoying those relationships.        They are comfortable expressing gratitude for all they have.        They are often the first to offer helping hands to coworkers and passersby.        They practice optimism when imagining their futures.        They savor lifes pleasures and try to live in the present moment.        They make physical exercise a weekly and even daily habit.        They are deeply committed to lifelong goals and ambitions (e.g., fighting fraud, building cabinets, or teaching their children their deeply held values).        Last but not least, the happiest people do have their share of stresses, crises, and even tragedies. They may become just as distressed and emotional in such circumstances as you or I, but their secret weapon is the poise and strength they show in coping in the face of challenge.

THE fancy term for really taking a second to appreciate those happy moments in your life. You often think that it's the world that makes you happy, but it's really how you respond to the world.

One of the key happiness principles is savoring. That's a fancy term for really taking a second to appreciate those happy moments in your life. You often think that it's the world that makes you happy, but it's really how you respond to the world. Those silly little things you do here and there in response to good moments; increasing those is the key to how to be happier without really trying

I was walking with my 2yo daughter in the stroller, and we got very close to a rabbit before either the rabbit or myself realized. I squatted down beside her, pointed at it, and asked her if she saw the bunny. She just looked and looked, and then she started to laugh. I asked if she was laughing at his long ears. And then the rabbit hopped away, and she lost it. She just laughed and laughed. I guess she wasn't expecting it to hop perhaps? It was the purest thing ever. I still feel happy about it.

Describe a happy event of your life" is an example of cue card topic that gives a candidate a wide range of options to pick from. You are virtually free to talk about any event that you think you would be flexible to talk about. On the contrary, the topic like "Describe a famous writer in your country" narrows your option. You can't just pick any writer and start talking about him. For the later topic, you need to think about such a writer and give some factual information about him

n my face, I feel a glow whenever I remember the day I went to the International trade fair with some of my friends. That was my first International trade fair visit and this was such a happy experience that I still feel a great joy reciting the memory of this event. It was January 1998 and that time I was in my first year of college.Until I finished my college, I was kind of a newborn lady, who had never visited any places without her places of her local area. After I got admitted into the college, I started exploring the world and the amazing things that invite people like us. One day I planned with my friends that we would visit International trade fair. This might seem like a very usual and banal event for others but to me, that was a really exciting thing to do. Later on, we did as we thought and finalised our visit to the fair. After break period at college, we escaped by the back door (As a side note, I would like to mention that Id no previous record of escaping school or college before). We were five in members and we hired a taxi to reach the trade fair. There wasnt enough space to sit on the back side of the taxi and the taxi driver gave a suspicious look at us. Thats why with a fishy smile we took the decision that one of us would sit in front of the baby taxi with the taxi driver. It was a funny decision but there was no alternative to us and we enjoyed it.

I was happy when I confronted my boyfriend about feeling neglected, and although we had been dealing with conflict, we were able to reason through the problem and agree to work together better to support each other.  I was happy that he acknowledged my feelings and that we were able to move through that particular challenge.  He made me feel much more appreciated and valued than I had been feeling on my own.

Last weekend, my adorable two year old son came running into my room on Saturday morning, with this arms full of blankets.  He crawled up on my bed and under the covers and we snuggled for about 30 minutes.  It was the best way to start my day, and i feel like those moments are so few and far between that I rarely get to enjoy them.

My boss told me in a meeting a few days ago that I am doing a good job with my challenging position.  it was so good to get that feedback, as I rarely hear anything good or bad.  It's very isolating to be in a management position, and I have been struggling to know if I am performing well or not, so it was very nice to get the feedback.

We had a certification audit where I work. I was hired specifically to get our organization certified and after 8 long months - we passed! If we had failed the audit, I would also have been fired. So not only did I get to keep my job, but it gave me credibility when I said I could get the company certified.

I got a bonus from work (not connected to previous audit). It was almost $2,000 and helped us to nearly pay off my wife's car. The bonus was based upon the amount of work that was generated by the organization in direct response to how much product I inspected and repairs that were initiated.

Well, this is a simple one but, my cat cuddles with me at night. He weighs 23lbs and is all muscle - but the gentle giant type. When I go to bed, he curls up with me, when I wake up, he is there. However one night last week he curled up, rolled onto his belly, rubbed his face into my chin and made little "coo" sounds while purring. It was adorable!

The kids really like it, especially my older son as he gets to see all of the farm animals and ride in tractors. Several moments like- parents praising us for good grades, getting a scholarship, winning basketball match, graduating successfully, getting first job, getting first salary, getting married, birth of first child.All such instances can be said as happiest moments in life.But do you think answering in one line, can benefit you in any sort?You will not be satisfied with the answer and neither will the interviewer be happy. So the question remains, which incident to speak about and how.Candidates can elaborate on the accomplishment they already mentioned on the resume. One can also speak of a topic totally out of the resume and take the interviewer by surprise.Very often talking something not mentioned on resume grabs the attention of the interviewer. Because thats exactly the thing he seeks.

Little things that make people feel happy at work 1.Sociable colleaguesIsnt everything better when you have nice colleagues to work with?2. Doing tasks that have meaning for meLets say your current job is just a means to pay your rent and youre waiting for a dream job opportunity. But, whatever youre doing you want to be appreciated for your work. And how can we judge a fish by its climbing skills? We cant.3. Constructive feedbackThe most important part of your work is feedback. No matter if its positive or negative (and then you will know what you have to change) feedback represents a very important instrument for measuring the quality of your work. Constructive feedback that gives you ideas for improvement can transform your day into a very productive and cheerful one.

4. Smiling co-workersA smile never cost anybody anything and a day seems to go better when you are surrounded by colleagues that smile and are willing to help you anytime or just to hug you when you are not feeling ok.5. Having a mentorNot anybody can brag about having a mentor at their job. A mentor is not only a teacher, it is the person that inspires you, the person from whom you want steal job know-how or hard-earned wisdom.6. A good training programWe all feel very motivated do our job the best way we can when we have a good training program. You can receive better feedback, you can be more focused on your work and you can improve your skills when you know youll be rewarded.7. Brainstorming sessionsBrainstorming sessions where we challenge our brains to come up with a mountain of ideas underneath which lies a single brilliant idea for a project are both relaxing and exhausting. Even though it seems like a paradox, a brainstorming session can actually summon all the creativity that we are capable of.8. Open-minded people aroundIf all the people around us would be open minded we would all have something to gain.9. A unique benefits packageWe bet you love free coffee or lunch, or free stuff included in your unique benefits package. Or maybe you prefer free gym or free parking. More and more employers are choosing to provide a coffee service in their office, gym memberships or stipends, lunches, or other benefits.

A friendly working environment 1. Playing games (only on lunch breaks)Taking a break once in a while is the key to success. So, why wouldnt you take advantage of your free time to revitalize your body and relax your brain cells?2. A room designed exclusively for funWouldnt your work environment be happier if you would have a room only for entertainment purposes? A room full of games where you can leave the stress behind?3. Short breaksShort going-out-for-some-air breaks give you the perfect time to have a moment for yourself in which you can analyze your daily problems.4. A clean desktop with a nice wallpaperIn order to be productive, we need to be organized. The same applies to your desk, your files and, of course, your desktop. A clean workspace gives you a great push when you want to start new things or tasks. And a happy wallpaper should bring a wide smile on your face.

I started running a month ago to get in shape. I huffed and puffed my way through a mile and proceed to go home and eat a hostess cupcake. I woke up the next day with blisters and a fierce determination that I would finish another mile. I did. I finished a mile the day after that, and the day after that. I picked up track and field that spring and never looked back. Through the process I not only fell in love with running, but the entire running lifestyle. Every day I am able to challenge myself and go on a new adventure. Fast or slow, long or short, each run is a chance to feel alive, energized, and ready to seize the day.

This week I started my field placement at West Street Elementary in Geneva, NY. My placement teacher is Mrs. Jennifer Davison, who works specifically with Math AIS students, specifically in kindergarten through second grade classrooms. Through worksheets and educational activities, Mrs. Davidson assists these targeted students to master age appropriate mathematics and attempts to help classroom teachers navigate the new common core requirements.Through acting as a positive educator and friend, I hope I can motivate students to preform better which makes me happy.

Right now, i'm currently living in a small trailer in Arkansas. I was born and raised in Florida, my entire life. I am unemployed and broke. I don't have many living option to return to in Florida. A couple of weeks ago, on a spur of the moment action, I took what gas money my dad could give me and I drove back to Florida to stay on my Uncle's couch to see if I could get my life in Florida back. For that time driving back, I had a feeling that maybe finally something was going to go good in my life. That finally my life would be restored. Of course, reality has a funny way of stomping on your hopes and dreams and shitting on your happiness. I got to my uncle's house in Florida (a small trailer occupied with four people already) to find out he doesn't have air conditioning in the living room where the couch is. The only air conditioners are window units in the bedrooms. Everything fell apart from there, and I had to bum gas money from my mom and step-father for the drive back to Arkansas. I feel as though I'm trapped in never-ending crushing despair.

My family went to the Outer Banks in North Carolina last week.  We rented a beach house right on the ocean.  It rained a little each day, but otherwise, we had sunshine and warm weather!  I swam in the ocean and the pool, relaxed at the beach, and read books.  I didn't check my phone or watch very much television.  One day, my sister and I went to an historic house called Whalehead and toured it.  We also saw the local lighthouse.  My favorite part was that each person cooked a meal, so I didn't have to make dinner every night.  I fell asleep each evening to the sound of the waves, and my bedroom in the rental house was comfortable with a great view.

My husband and I went to a Nationals baseball game several weeks ago.  The Nats didn't win, but we still had a great time.  The weather was absolutely perfect.  We had seats on the club level, and the bar was close by!  We got tequila & soda, and ate nachos and cotton candy.  We had fun cheering for the home team, watching the mascots race, and doing the 7th inning stretch.

My husband and I were finally able to afford new hardwood floors for the main level of our house, and they were installed last month.  We had white carpet that had gotten pretty dirty, so it is nice to have clean, new floors.  It also helped us build equity in the house, and makes the space look much bigger.  Every time I come downstairs, I'm pleased with how the house looks.

Once a month, our children and their spouses and their children come home for dinner. We crowd the place up, with tables in at least three different rooms, especially now that the grandchildren have started bringing their boyfriends and girlfriends. There is almost always singing  almost always a birthday to celebrate. The ten-years-old and younger bunch have little interest in dinner  weve debated on whether or not we should set up a table for them at all. They make a beeline for the backdoor; for the sandbox, the jungle gym, and the swing set. My children and their spouses crowd up at the kitchen table. Where the kids once jockeyed for elbow room and provoked each other on general principle, they now squeeze up to be together and provoke each other to laughter. Even after they all leave, the house has the feel of their presence, and I am happy.

I was in line at the grocery store the other day, and a younger guy in front of me asked if he should buy chocolate Turtles, as he had never had them before. I told him that theyre delicious and worthy of his money, and then the cashier jumped in to describe the pleasure of eating a Turtle in racy and explicit detail. Both of us were just dying of laughter, and we somehow ended up asking her if she wrote fanfic. It was beautiful. I dont know why Im telling you this.

I was living with my Uncle until two months ago. He had 4 cats, but 2 died. The two remaining cats were not as social as the ones that died, and it really depressed my Uncle. I found a very pregnant, very thin stray black cat. I have a houseful of rescues because ignoring a sick or neglected animal is not something I do. I coaxed the little cat over to me because she was very shy and skittish at first, then I took her to the veterinarian immediately to get a blood test for FIV or feLV. She was negative for both so I took her home and she was very friendly and attached at the hip within days. I fed her, gave her vitamins, and made up a box for her to have the kittens. She had 5 precious babies that are now running around and playing on their own.

Recently my boss gave me a raise for all the hard work and commitment I had been giving to the business. This changed my life and allowed me to pay off a lot of the debt I was currently in. I was extremely thankful and happy to be given a raise. This has changed me all around and now I walk around less stressed and with a more positive attitude.

My brother and his wife announced they were having a baby boy. I was extremely happy and excited to hear this because I know how much my brother wanted to have a kid and raise a boy. Anytime my family is happy it makes me extremely happy to see the loved ones in my life doing well.

My dog was developing bumps on her body and this made me worried she might have cancer. I took her to the doctor to get her checked out and a week later we got the results that she was cancer free. I was so elated that my dog was healthy and she didn't have cancer. I took her to the beach when I heard the news and then a dog park to celebrate. I was extremely relieved and happy that my best friend was going to be okay.

This last weekend we held our reunion. Lots of family I hadn't see in a long time. Our grandkids got to meet cousins they'd never met. It was a wonderful long weekend.

An event that made me happy was when I helped my friend plan her daughters wedding.  She was very overwhelmed at the thought of giving her daughter a wedding.  She was actually physically ill from it.  Her daughter was very easy to work with.  She wanted "barn chic" with burgandy and gold accents.  Her dad set up the lighting in the back yard and got all the tables and I fluffed it up.  Seeing the bride and grooms huge smiles and hearing them say the whole day and evening was perfect made me happy!

Another event that made me happy was when I went to California with my mom, my sisters and their kids and my family.  We had a vacation not a trip.  There is a difference.  A vacation is when you relax and spend time together.  A trip is when you are running around like a crazy person doing all the sightseeing.  It made be happy to sit on the beach and sleep. and do nothing.

A third event that made me happy was when I decided to join a gym.  That sounds weird but to me it represents that I am finally taking care of myself first.  I have been going 4 weeks now and I feel better.  Its the first time in 12 years I don't have to take anyone to school and I can hit the gym after my teens leave in the morning.  It's my time now.
I received back injections yesterday for my back pain and I'm feeling great today, the only needles that make me happy.

An event that made me extremely happy was when my mom's neurologists read her MRI reports and informed me that after 5 brain surgeries,her brain tumor is stabilized and has not continued to grow within the past two years.
An event that made me happy was seeing my unborn son's face on an ultrasound and being confirmed that he is developing well.

I am moving into my new apartment in a few weeks, which is when school starts. That also means I will be saying goodbye to my boyfriend again since we go to different schools. He doesn't like my school, but he said he would definitely come visit me during our winter breaks. He said he would most likely drive to me, and I am about 5 hours away from him. It made me really happy because I didn't think he'd want to do that trip.

But he got me something anyways and it made me happy because it satisfied my craving and he didn't ask me to pay him back.

Getting to hang out with all of my family over the summer was great because I only get to see them once every year and they are just so fun to be around.

About a month ago my 10 month old son started babbling more and said the words "mama" and "dada".  Hearing him say this made me happy, even though I know he does not yet really associate our persons as being mom and dad.  This is another milestone in his life that make me proud to be his mother.

I recently went to Key West for my sister in law's wedding.  While there I was not only able to enjoy a vacation with my family, but the wedding itself made me feel overwhelming joy for the two of them and the life that they will be starting.  The ceremony itself was short and simple on the beach, yet so touching and meaningful.  It was the perfect wedding.

I recently had my hair and make up done for an event and do not normally wear any kind of make up like I had on that day.  It made me feel extra special and extra beautiful giving me a little more self confidence than I usually have.  It's nice to be able to be pampered every now and then and do something you normally wouldn't do.

We were on vacation this summer and I got to play with my 6 month old daughter in the pool for the first time. She loved the water and was having a great time. I enjoy watching her laugh and experiencing things for the first time.

My wife had been wanting to hit some whiffle balls for a while. She had been playing with our nieces and wanted to hit some more in our yard. I bought some balls and a bat and I pitch to her while she hits. We have a fence so she is able to try and hit home runs. We have a baby swing on a tree for our daughter and she sits and watches us play. She is entertained by it and will laugh and swing. All of us are having fun playing a kids game.

My daughter is pretty attached to my wife right now as she breast feeds and takes care of her most of the time. Generally she will hold her hands out that she wants her mommy, but the other day she reached out and wanted me. It's a small thing but it made me happy.

I went to the creek with my Daughter and Grandson. My grandson was a little afraid of the water and I got him to walk out in it. He wanted to throw the rocks in the bottom of the creek but was afraid to put his hand in the water to get them. I convinced him it was ok to put his hand under water and pick up the rocks.

I made a rather large salad for dinner tonight. One of my housemates was in the kitchen with me when it was done. I asked him if he would like some. He said he would love it and thanked me.

Recently, I found this platform online that Google made to support the work of creatives. it's called Chrome Experiments- people can post their projects  for other people to see, projects built on technologies like machine learning, browser libraries, etc. There was this game called Rotopo that had a few thousands plays on Chrome Experiments, and I wasn't sure what it was about the game, but it really put me in a good place when I was feeling down in the dumps. It reminded me how much I love puzzle games, and why I started making games in the first place. For once in a long time, I felt a piece of my inner child.

A few artists came together and started a band: Kid Cudi and Kanye West, which was kind of surprising because both of them had a falling out and weren't on speaking terms as much, so seeing my two favorite artists come together and make an album that challenges ideas of mental health and suicide was a highlight of the summer for me. Seeing them both struggle with mental health, but somehow come together and prosper allows me to see the realm of possibilities within myself.

I saw this small instrument called a Kalimba. i think it was used for a bunch of television soundtracks like The Last Airbender and Legend Of Korra. It's small enough to fit in your pocket and easy to learn, yet it sounds so peaceful. It reminded me of the simpler things in life.

An event that made me happy was when my daughter turned to me randomly and hugged me, saying "Mommy, I love you."  It made my heart melt, like I was doing something right as a parent.

Another event that made me happy was when my dog, who is usually quite antisocial, greeted me when I returned home and licked my face.  This is  not something he usually does, so it was unexpected, but very welcome.

A final event that made me happy was watching my daughter laugh and play at a local splash park.  She was enjoying the summer sun and water activities, and seeing her smile made me a happy mom.  Moms just want their kids to love life.

An envelope came in the mail. From the return address, I saw it was from the welfare office. This immediately made me anxious, because I figured they would want documentation on something or were cutting some of my benefits. But I was surprised when I opened it, because it was actually an unexpected INCREASE in my Foot Stamp benefits from $105/month to $165. I mean, by shopping at Aldi, I can make it through the month on $105, but with $165, I will be able to go to Giant Eagle and buy some luxury things like Stouffer's frozen dinners or Clausen pickels.

She works as a bartender at two different restaurants, making good money, supporting herself. I hate the idea of her ending up owing tens of thousands of dollars in student loans for a degree that doesn't really interest her. She'll figure out her way.

She was drunk that day, but she couldn't stop talking about her boyfriend and showing affection, and her boyfriend was just quiet and smiling, clearly in love with her too. My friend also wouldn't stop reminding him and the friends around us that I was the friend who gave her advice 7 months ago to go on a date with him; in other words, he has me to thank for them being a couple now. Since they're talking about getting married, I'm really happy that I contributed to their happiness.

Last summer when I was camping and looked up to see the Milky Way perfectly visible. It had been a crazy night where one of my friends had gotten real sick and we had to call an ambulance. After the chaos, we all laid down and looked up to see the sky illuminated and I felt at peace despite the craziness that comes with life. It is one image I will never forget as I was just in awe at how majestic and large our universe is and how even with its vastness I was here and had a part in it. Also, when I look up at the sky, I feel as if my family or loved ones who have passed on are up there and I kinda imagine that they are smiling down and watching over me

I had the opportunity to go on a mission trip to Chiang Mai, Thailand. We visited a few of the surrounding villages spending time with the people and helping build churches and other much needed things. One day we were laying cement and beginning to construct bathrooms outside a church when I saw a little girl watching me from far away. When we took a break I decided to run over to her. We spent the afternoon running around, dancing and giving piggy back rides. I soon found out that her name was Ititaya, and the language barrier couldn't keep my heart from falling in love. The next day as I walked up the hill to the church we were working at, I saw a small girl running down the hill. I bent down to pick her up and she jumped into my arms and kissed my cheek. I was overwhelmed. In Thailand, the people are very friendly, but not always touchy and visible with their love, so the innocent kiss on my cheek melted my heart. I will never forget this moment

The most recent thing that made me happy has to be getting married. I was married to my girlfriend of 5 years on July 21st, 2018. We were high school sweethearts, and it made me incredibly happy to finally be married in the beautiful state of Vermont in the heat of summer. We got married with the most terrific scenery, surrounded by farm fields and forestry. We saw enormous amounts of family there. My wife and I actually had just gotten over a string of arguments with her family. It took a lot to stomach our pride and make sure that her father was there to bring her down the aisle. There were smiles, laughter, and joy all day regardless. It's a day of my life that I will never forget.

In June of 2018, my younger brother graduated from high school. He's the youngest of four kids, and the last one of us to exit high school. I had a lot of family there that day, from my aunts to my grandparents. There was lots of smiles, but there was also a lot of tears. My family lives in a different era now. I'd by lying if I said I was completely happy about it, but seeing my little brother up on that stage in a cap and gown, receiving his hard-earned diploma makes me smile anyway. I wouldn't trade it for the world.

I have a daughter that is soon to be 10 months old in a few days. Just recently, her baby babble talk has started turning into phonetics. Things like "gaga" and "muh" have turned into "Dada" and "Mama" and "Nana." She's growing everyday, but part of me doesn't want that quite yet. The first day she was able to fluently say "Dada" made me the happiest father in the world. I cried. Mostly because I was happy that she is learning to communicate, and that she recognizes me as me. But also because I'm sad that she's getting so grown already. She'll be a year old in October, and that day will renew this happiness. I'm just glad I got the chance to be a father.

The birth of our first grandchildren was a recent event that made me very happy.  It is great having adult children, and even better when they settle down with a spouse and start a family.  My husband and I were "older" parents when our sons were born and we were in our early thirties.  Our sons and wives also are becoming parents in their young thirties.  They are emotionally and fiscally ready to be parents.  Our first grandchild was born in early July and our second grandchild was born a couple days later.  We are lucky in that we all live in the same metropolitan area, so we will be able to interact with our grandchildren frequently in the years to come.  Each day of enjoying the company of the newborns and helping their parents brings me great joy.

It was like having a part of my old wife back for a while.

Rumination, the habit of repeatedly chewing sad experiences or conversations, is like getting stuck in the sand. You dont make any progress. Your whole life gets stuck.Im not saying we rehash sad memories on purpose. I do that too. It took me time to realize that ruminating is an ineffective coping behavior. I started to practice how to delete sad memories. Forgetting a bad experience is truly liberating.Then, why do most people love rehashing memories?We expect a different outcome. By reliving over and over a story, we tend to believe that things are going to change. Unfortunately, no matter how many storylines you create in your mind, what happened wont change. What you can change is how you feel about it.so i have it happy event 3 months

A happy mood clouds our judgement. We are so happy enjoying a particular moment that we remember it being better than it actually was according to a study by the University of Virginia. On the other hand, when we feel sad, our memory is more accurate: we remember every detail of lost 3 months so happy event.

From ancient scriptures to the latest science, gratitude is known to be good for us and those around us. Yet it isn't always our automatic response and we often take the good things in our lives for granted. So we have to consciously learn to get into the habit of being grateful.Science is showing that gratitude is important for how good we feel psychologically and socially. It increases how much positive emotion we feel and decreases negative emotion. It raises our overall satisfaction with life and helps us have an overall positive outlook. It has also been shown to reduce health complaints and help us cope with difficulties. It even seems to reduce the importance we place on material goods. And contrary to what we may think, it also appears that it could increase our ability to achieve our goals.so i have happy moment in last 3 months.

I live in a forested area.  My home has a meadow and a wooded section.  One evening, I went into my yard to bring in a bird feeder so the raccoons won't raid it. She decided to stay home with me for six more years and attend college right here in town so she can be the teacher she has always wanted to be. Instead of empty, the nest is full of love now. My daughter is here along with our two new puppies and the old puppy. I can't imagine being any happier.

What made me happy in the past 3 months is promoting to full time status at work. Now, I qualify for health benefits for my family and paid vacation hours. I now have the opportunity to spend paid time off with my family, and I don't have to pay for full price for medical and dental bills.

An event that has made me happy in the last three months would be the opening of my local farmers market.  It opened 3 weeks ago and I always look forward to it.  I get  a chance to get fresh, local produce at a great price, while supporting my local economy.

Another event that brought happiness would be swimming with my family at a local beach.  We like to go swimming when the sun is setting, and this particular night the sunset was incredible, and we had a lot of fun.

I took my dog for a walk.  It may not seem like much but my dog has health issues, and is afraid of everything.  We live in an area where there are frequent fireworks and it makes my dog a mess, as well as her not being able to walk much.  Last week I was able to take her, all happy, for a half hour long walk.  It was a beautiful day and she seemed to really enjoy herself.

To celebrate my older brother's birthday, my family gathered together and then drove over to Sarnia, Canada to spend the day. His birthday was July 21st and it was a beautiful sunny warm day. The best, the absolute best part was that my brother, my sister in law and several other family members were all together. My brother had been in a terrible motorcycle accident and has trouble remembering many things we shared in the past. But this day he seemed happy and relaxed. He was more like his old self than he had been in a long while, and that made my heart happy.

This is another thing that made me happy recently: my sister in law and I decided that we should get together, just the two of us, and go out the Tea Time Restaurant which had recently opened her town. Having Tea together was a way to celebrate my mother, who was born in Canada and who would take us to Windsor and then out to Tea as a treat when I was growing up. My mom has passed but having Tea with my SIL was a special way to remember my mom, and it just seemed like the old days. Plus we both love High Tea and enjoy the tea and the food.

My birthday is two weeks after my brother's birthday but we still get together and have cake and ice cream just as if we hadn't been together recently. My other siblings called, left emails and even sang Happy Birthday to me! Two of my very oldest friends called and that made very happy; I felt important to other people and part of a tight social and family group which gives me strength. I felt loved and appreciated.

On July 11 I had a 20 week ultrasound of baby due in November.  My spouse and I were able to see our baby for the first time and find out that we were having a girl for our second child.  We were happy to hear from the technician that baby was healthy and developing on track.  I felt excited to finally know the gender and couldn't wait to be able to share the new with our family and friends.

My husband, two year old son and myself were able to travel to his hometown and meet up with college friends for a birthday party for my friends 2 year old daughter.  We were only there for a few hours, but had a great time catching up with them since we don't get to see these friends often.  I felt happy getting to talk recent experiencing in raising my two year old son with my friend Ann who also has a two year old girl along with two other children under the age of 4.  Getting to voice my opinions and recent daily experience with my son with another mom made me feel connected and happy.

One month ago I was able attend one of my closest friend's wedding in Chicago.  I was able to be a part of her wedding by being a bridesmaid.  My spouse and I were able to find time to go on a little weekend vacation without our son and spend some quality time together as a married couple.  I was so moved by all of the events of the day and in particular the speech that was given by the grooms brother.  He spoke such kind and true words about the relationship he has with his brother and I was very much touched and brought to tears by his speech.  The love he demonstrated for his brother was so sweet and touching.

An event that made me happy in the past three months would be last week, when my 19 month old daughter said "Love you, bye" for the first time. She has been a little delayed in other areas so her putting together three words was huge! She just got so excited and very, clearly said "Love you, bye!".

An event that made me happy in the past 3 months would be, when I graduated college last month. I have two young children, one of which has Autism so, that made going to school difficult. However, I took the leap, went to school, and I graduated with a 3.5 GPA. I was very happy and so proud of myself.

An event that made me happy in the past 3 months would be, when my son started peeing in the toilet two weeks ago. My son is 5 years old and has Autism, so, doing typical things like using the toilet are difficult for a lot of children with Autism. Therefore, this was a very big moment for me as a parent and has brought me so much hope and happiness after a 3 year battle.

Three days ago I went fishing. It was the first time I have done so since I was a kid. We have a pond on the property where I live and I have been here five years, but finally went and bought a cane pole.  I bought some worms at the local store and went out on the dock. My daughter in law joined me which I felt good about as it was nice to just sit together and talk a little, enjoying the calm.  Then we both got strikes.  Several right after another. They were nice pan fry size. A total of six. Three fish caught by each of us. It make me happy for at least an hour. I felt happy when I caught each one,  as I saw my son come up and check out the bucket, when he was cleaning them and smiling, and later when he ate them! So happiness over some time. Looking forward to doing it again.

I ordered a new lawn mower because my old one was breaking. It arrived on time, and I was able to assemble it and fill it with oil. I now feel happy knowing that the next time I need to mow the yard, I have a shiny new mower ready to go.

Coming up with a solution to a problem. My grandfather is having trouble hearing, but hates wearing hearing aids because they are annoying or trouble to keep up with. My father is annoyed that he no longer can converse with my grandfather. Through some idea brainstorming, I was able to think of a way to accomplish his goal for free. They already have a Bluetooth headset and an old cellphone, so adding a microphone app to the cellphone allows it to work as a microphone and broadcast into the headset, allowing my grandfather to hear and participate in conversations again. Solving this issue makes me feel happy still.

Solving another problem. I have been having trouble with eating and digestion and didn't know why. Through some trial and error, and searching for answers, I was able to find out I have a fructose malabsorbtion problem. Knowing this allows me to more effectively change up my diet to reduce pain and negative symptoms. I feel happy and relieved as a result.

Our life has many journeys. Whether short or long, each journey brings us new things, useful knowledge, or feelings of relaxation and relief bring life to the soul, to temporarily forget all bon chen bustling life, to soul with natural air; Away from the calculations of ordinary life, release the heart in the peaceful moments of life.It's a great feeling to walk into a clean, clean hotel room, and lie on a comfortable mattress bed whenever you want. Not interested in any work, there is no long list of things to do in the morning before waking up husband, children as I usually do at home and only one thing that is thinking for For yourself, for your own needs, enjoy the delicious food prepared ...The world is still floating and we sit and chat, laugh without the need to rush anything, not race with the clock. Because the gift I receive now is the time of rest. That gift helps me understand what I want. When the mood is unhappy, the comfort of nature will promptly help me get back to excitement. The airiness of space, the feeling of freedom, the wind and the sky are close at hand will encourage, help me escape sad.

We live in peacetime enjoying the freedom and happiness of independence. To get Vietnam today, it is thanks to the great merit, the noble sacrifice of his fathers, the heroic the heroic Vietnamese mothers ... are ready to sacrifice their lives in exchange for us today enjoy living in peace. The images, the events of the liberation war, we are told, or through television, movies ... have shown us some of the fierce war.But those are not enough to describe the full and true to the class I held a visit to the "War Memorial Museum". This is the occasion for us to feel the indomitable resilience of the national heroes during the fierce resistance years.When I was standing at the war memorial museum, I admired the more stubborn Vietnamese, sacrificed a part of their bodies, even the lives and happiness of their lives in exchange for them. I am the young generation of peace country today.

One of my  happy events of my life  , I would like to talk about the event that I can still remember vividly regarding my success in the board exam. The moment I heard that I had been awarded a scholarship based on my performance in the board exam, I became the happiest man in the world. This was indeed a very happy moment for me as it is something I was looking forward to achieving and the news made my parents quite happy and proud.I spent almost a month with great anxiety regarding my result publication. I started speculating so many things and many of them were negative. I could hardly keep away the tensions about my upcoming result. The result was so important that my college admission would mostly depend on it. I could not sleep well in the night before the result publishing. I think this is a common anxiety for students and I was familiar with this type of anxiety. However, this particular exam results game me more nightmares than any other time of my life.The result was published at around 11.00 am and I found that I did exceptionally well. I was so relieved and happy that I literally shouted. Then I hurriedly came back to our home and gave the news to my parents. They were happy too. My father bought sweets and my mother gave it to our neighbours. I felt excited, happy and relieved.

On and off for the past five years I've been looking for another job.  Due to age (in my opinion), location (not a lot of jobs here due to a lot of people), and the type of work I need (part-time), there hasn't been very many call backs.  Finally, I got a call for an interview two weeks ago!  Although the location was 30 miles (one way) from my home I was over the moon happy with the thought of changing jobs.  The interview went great because she used to work where I am working now.  We clicked!  The idea of a new experience, a new place to work, all the newness puts a smile on my face!  (I haven't started working there yet, background checks and all that stuff. Soon though, soon!)

We took our family vacation towards the end of June, the hottest possible time in the South.  For some reason the car's air conditioning kept conking out during our drive which makes for a long, hot, angry drive.  We endured this during our vacation.  Finally on way home the GPS warned us of an accident ahead on the freeway so we decided to take a detour.  A long detour. The detour route ended up being the best thing ever!  It was really the back roads, two lanes, farms and trees.  However there wasn't any traffic!  During this the air conditioner conked out again, and we rolled down our windows.  This time it was lovely because it was cooler, the air was cleaner and we were able to drive (instead of stop-and-go) through the rolling hills.  My heart was singing because everything felt so right, despite the mishaps.

This one is a little bit harder to come up with.  I guess in the end I trivialize when things make me happy, even for a fleeting moment, so I don't take notice.  Waking up every morning I stick my head outside to gauge how hot it is.  It's been stinking hot here since May and will be until November.  Just this morning, after a nice rain (not that jungle rain followed by the humidity) the air finally cooled down.  I was able to go sit on my favorite chair outside and have my coffee and enjoy the breeze.  It was pure bliss.  I will probably go back out there soon before the sun comes blasting to that side of my house and make it 200 degrees.  It is the little things that make up the big things in life (not to sound to cliche).

My family and I enjoyed a 4th of July with our neighbors and watched the fireworks explode above our heads.My first happy event was the Fourth of July. My family and I spent the whole day at my uncle's apartment, waiting for the sun to set. The night before, my mother and I cleaned our whole house, thinking the special occasion would be held at our place. Thankfully it was not. The whole day was a mess, but we were numbed by the new face my uncle introduced. His new girlfriend. She had a lot of interesting things to say and she enjoyed our company. I also got to play with my uncle's Nintendo Switch. I'm too poor to have new game cartridges, so I was having a blast.As the sun set, we all gathered outside and watched the fireworks. The last time I had seen fireworks that close was when I was less than ten years old. And the whole evening was rooted with nostalgia. The sparks danced above my head, neighbors hooting in a drunken daze. And I snapped photos of each one.

A friend of mine met up with me and we talked about our future.Each year, California hosts an anime convention in LA. For two years, I managed to go with my friends. This year I wasn't able to attend, but my friend asked if she could borrow a wig of mine. A friend of hers got it for her three days before the convention. A couple of weeks later, she got back to me and wanted to return it. And so, we set up a date to meet up with each other. The days leading up to the meeting filled my gut with anxiety. I didn't want her to think I was sickly or depressed. I'm naturally skinny, so I often gave people that impression if I didn't exercise. But as soon as I saw her, I lost all my insecurities. We talked about what we were planning for the future, how the convention went, about my younger siblings. I felt like an ounce of who I used to be. And I was glad we were still friends.

My youngest siblings watched old VHS movies from my youth and they watched with interest.My two youngest siblings are fourteen years younger than I am. They didn't grow up with a flip phone like I did, the animation I was exposed to, the princesses I adored. So, when we managed to hook the VHS player to out flat screen, I was ecstatic to pull out all the VHS tapes of my favorite Disney movies. Of course, not everything was salvaged from our youth, but l watching the tapes with my siblings was enough.

Lagore Mehendi is a one of my favorite event that happened recently. I eagerly wait for the year to come again. For Event, we design pumpkin kind of dressing or any special look, like a devil, angel dressing, vegetables and fruits cutting dress designs, cartoon dressing etc., and many more especially for kids. I design for my kid every Event year.I saw a kid wearing a Event dress with front and back of a dress body in a celebration get together. The dress was designed as the front part of the body says about a human being life with happiness, sorrow, angry, fear, anxiety, enthusiastic, arrogant, depressed etc., and back part of the body is all about vegetables & fruits that a human needs to follow frequently.I do still remember the kid. I was impressed with the dress design as it was an awesome thought of a designing a dress with a combination of vegetables & fruits and about a human being life. The dress on the front part is an wonderful thought, a message to people about how a human life carries wishes, pains, struggles, how we need to face them, what happens when we get angry. Each part of a life again comes with icons along with description like happiness has one icon, sorrow, angry, enthusiastic. The boy even behaves similar to the body stated on the whole day of Event, looks like how dedication they have towards to the festival and their hard work. The dress on the back part was like head designed with apple & pomegranate makeup, nose as a small grape, eyes with black colored makeup, ears like straw berries hanging, shoulders with papaya, hands with snake guard, fingers with lady fingers and in the middle of the body it appears like leafs pasted around the body, the legs with cucumber designed.etc.,

My dad has cancer and we thought he was going to die.  He was so sick.  He had lost a lot of kidney function. They took him off chemo and his kidney's somehow bounced back.   He has been able here for the past couple months due to this.  It's almost like he's not sick.  He seems normal.  I know this might seem bad to some people, but I prayed for more good days.  He ha so many bad days where he was so sick and couldn't even get out of bed.  He was suffering.  I just wanted more good days before he's gone.  My prayers were answered.  We have more good days, and this makes me happier than anyone knows.

My journey to Ooty started in Madikeri. I did not bother checking the distance nor the time of the ride between the two cities, i just knew that Ooty is somewhere to the south, i went to the bus station and caught a bus (a spontaneous start for that Ooty travel experience).The bus ride started and i was enjoying the scenery of the Kodagu district (more on that area in the Madikeri post), at some point i felt that we were going east, and not south as expected. The local guy who was sitting near me asked me what was wrong, i told him my thoughts, and he confirmed, the bus actually was on its way to Mysore (Eastern part of Karnataka state). The guy told me that the final stop of the bus was Ooty (good news), the bad news were that Mysore is in a completely opposite direction, which meant that my bus ride was going to be longer than i though it would be. I did not care much, I still had around 9 months of travel time left, so I made myself comfortable on the seat, smiled and got into a conversation with my bus ride mate.The bus ride was really long, a one and a half hours stop in Mysore, few more hours on the road, a stop on the entrance to Bandipur wildlife sanctuary from 2AM-6AM and..The UltimOoty:I arrived to the Queen of the hill stations at about 10AM, which summed up a total of sixteen hours bus ride and the official beginning of my Ooty travel experience. The Ooty central bus station is close to the cheap accommodation area called the Bazaar Road, even the budget guesthouses are still a little more expensive in Ooty if compared to other parts of India. Expect to pay at least 400INR for a double room. I wanted some luxury, so i got a room in Hotel Manek for 600INR, which included a big double bed, T.V with many channels and hot water buckets for shower at any time of day

As I can remember, when I was younger I used to held parties at my home solely with my family and relatives. Especially on my birthdays, my mom cooked my favourite foods and made my favourite birthday cake with chocolate. Now that I am not a teenager anymore, I go out with my friends and in some special circumstances with my family as well. For example, on my graduation day, I went to a Greek restaurant with my parents, brother and my five best friends and we had a really great time. Generally speaking, I would say that I am more of an introvert person, so I totally prefer to spend substantial time with few friends rather than having many people and typical relationships. My happy moments and celebrations are also related to my friends and family members.

I have twin 13 year old nieces. One day, they asked if we could have a slumber party at my house.  That evening, after they had fallen asleep, I was so grateful and so happy that I have such precious nieces and that my brother let them spend time with me. I love these girls very much. My cousin asked me to paint a cornucopia for her. When I paint, I get into a place of peace & happiness. The world seems to go away. It's similar to meditation. The cornucopia turned out far better than my then my wildest imaginings. I was thrilled with it; pleased that something I thought was going to be difficult turned out so pretty. My cousin is using it for an invitation & I am pleased with the way it works with the typesetting. There is a lot of happiness associated with the cornucopia. The painting process itself, along with the results & giving my cousin a gift - all of it makes me happy every time I think about it. I think it was one of my best pieces.

After being looking for a disease that doctors had me tired of, physically and emotionally I collapsed. However one day, tired of everything that had revolutionized my life years ago, I arrive to my bedroom, I lean back and see my daughter sleep peacefully next to me. With a certain smile on their faces asleep and magically felt a great happiness. That day I slept peacefully and the next day I was very present with her, I enjoyed every smile of them, I carefully observed her personality, I enjoyed them and in some way I felt free and happy again. Every day I get excited even when it is not easy to deal with ourselves in fact. Be happy with nothing but what I blessedly have.

I married very young and at the time I found out that my wife was pregnant I did not want to know the sex of the baby, When it was the last ultrasound done to my wife a few weeks before delivery, the doctor told me if at the end I wanted to know the sex. Accept Then he told me I was a girl and it was one of the happiest moments of my life. I screamed like crazy. Weeks later, the day of delivery, I could not be in the clinic, because I was taking an exam in a master's degree. When I returned to the clinic and saw my wife next to the baby, what do you think I did? I took off his clothes and diaper to see what the doctor had told me was true ...! It's been almost 6 years now, and my precious Gaby is the love of my life.

I think I've had a lot of luck in this life and that, even though I had to live through terrible things, all that path of flowers and stones have brought me to where I am today and that if I had saved one of the potholes, only a few of the smiles, one of the bad decisions, I would not be where I am now and for that reason, I am proud to be here as much as of the way traveled. Therefore, looking back I am able to remember many moments in which I could feel that fullness, that feeling that your soul expands and you are infinite that some call happiness. However, one, has come to my mind, fast, urgent, eager to be told. It was when, for the first time, I had in front of me the one who is now my wife and she kissed me.

Surprise someone by bringing up a positive thing that she did in the past, and you're almost guaranteed to induce a positive response. Maybe it's a joke the person told that you're still laughing about; maybe it's a small act of heroism she performed. Regardless, if it's something she thought was long forgotten, learning that something she did made a positive, lasting impression on someone else is an amazing experience.

For purposes of this HIT, the specific moment is:   I woke up in Loreto, Mexico and a friend opened the curtain early in the morning to reveal the sunrise.    Additional details on the totality of experience are as follows (optional):I took a trip to Loreto, Mexico in early May with friends and found it enjoyable for a number of reasons.  Perhaps one of the most enjoyable components was that the trip was mostly schedule and commitment free.  There was no where to be and very few expectations.  There was room for predictable and anticipated events and time and flexibility for unexpected ones.  Some of the more memorable moments were sharing meals with friends at a taco place that was slow and had no climate control (open windows).  The food was amazing and merely watching the workers (who appeared to be father and son and were likely the owners) was in of itself enjoyable and comforting.  The fish tacos were amazing and the fish to make them likely caught locally and recently; the lime juice squeezed moments before.  Speaking of comfort, happiness was experienced at the hotel where there was an incredible sunrise available from the comfort of one's bed.  The colors of orange over the Sea of Cortez / Gulf of California  (which was incredibly calm and free of visible waves) were vibrant and slowly changing as the sun took it's place higher in the morning sky.Upon reflection, happiness was experienced in part due to the perception of safety.  This may in part be due to the relaxed nature of tourists and locals alike.  It may also be in part due to the inability to understand the language.   While that may seem a bit strange, there was a comfort in not needing (consciously, subconsciously or otherwise)  to process or interpret signs, billboards, advertising or even the conversations taking place around me as they were all in Spanish and the ability to comprehend or the desire to understand was limited only to those that were necessary.

For purposes of this HIT, the specific moment is:    I spent an afternoon taking photos and catching up with a relative while on vacation in Jamaica.  (Additional details below)In late may, early June I reconnected with immediate and extended family for a reunion in Jamaica.  While the entirety of the trip was enjoyable, one moment spending a few hours with a cousin from Zimbabwe whilst on holiday in Jamaica created an atmosphere evoking happiness.  She and I spent and afternoon talking about philosophical aspects of this existence while taking photos around the resort in which we were staying.  It was enjoyable for a number of reasons.  The first was the ability to speak honestly and truthfully without fear of judgement.  The weather on this Jamaica evening was perfect - warm but pleasant.  I appreciated seeing the things she was compelled to take photos of and hearing her rationale.   It was also enjoyable to create an activity that engaged the mind to consider what it was seeing.  As we walked through the resort, we talked with two people.  One who said something alone the lines of 'You're my brother and sister' when I expressed hesitation about taking photos of her wares (which she was selling without compensation).  The other man we spoke with was on top of a lookout tour underneath which there were a whole bunch of recyclable bottles.  Turned out there was a friendly competition among staff to collect and recycle as much as possible.  The combination of reconnecting, perhaps growing closer to a distant cousin, coupled with beautiful weather, a full stomach, a sense of safety, the sounds and sights of the ocean and an engaging art project without expectation and nice staff made for a true moment of happiness.

For purposes of this HIT, the specific moment is:    Within the last two weeks, I shared a day at a nude beach outside Portland, Oregon with a friend.   (Additional details below).Joy was experienced on this day for a number of reasons.  Beautiful scenery that was almost entirely of nature (a river, mountains, trees and grasses), the sounds of birds, good conversation, the sensations of wind on the skin and very little in terms of words or man made symbols to interpret.  While almost all aspects were enjoyable, walking through the woods shoe and clothing free while picking and eating berries was particularly enjoyable, stress free and happiness invoking.
